channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Kamala Harris has bigger cognitive problems than 'crooked' Joe: Donald Trump
item.description: Donald Trump, speaking at a Georgia rally, criticized vice president Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden. He alleged that Harris has more significant cognitive issues than Biden and claimed the world is laughing at her potential presidency. Trump also blamed their policies for increased inflation and global conflicts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I wanted to die so many times': Hamas hostage recalls her days in captivity
item.description: Aviva Siegel was kidnapped during Hamas' attack on October 7 and released after weeks in captivity. Her husband Keith remains a hostage. Since her release last November as part of a truce, Aviva has been protesting for his freedom. The urgency increased after the Israeli military discovered six hostage bodies in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thailand's historic same-sex marriage bill gets royal endorsement
item.description: Thailand's King has endorsed a historic marriage equality bill passed by parliament on June 18. Effective January 22, 2025, this law makes Thailand the first Southeast Asian country to legalise same-sex marriage. It grants equal rights to same-sex couples but does not address transgender and non-binary individuals' issues regarding identity documents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Zelenskyy rejects talks, calls for unspecified global 'action' to force Russia into peace
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the UN Security Council, dismissing peace talks with Russia and urging global action to end the invasion. He insisted that Russia must be compelled into peace. The session saw strong backing for Ukraine's sovereignty from UN officials, while US Secretary of State Antony Blinken accused China, Iran, and North Korea of aiding Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden-Yunus meet in New York: US, Bangladesh affirm 'close partnership'
item.description: US President Joe Biden and Bangladesh's interim government chief Mohammed Yunus affirmed a close partnership, with Biden expressing support for Bangladesh's new reform agenda. They met at the UN General Assembly, where Yunus discussed student protests in Bangladesh. Upon arriving in New York, Yunus faced protests from demonstrators.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Swiss police make arrests after suicide capsule is used for first time
item.description: Swiss police have arrested multiple individuals following the first use of the 'Sarco' suicide capsule in Schaffhausen. Created by Philip Nitschke, the device induces death via nitrogen gas. Authorities are investigating charges of inducing and aiding suicide. The deceased was a 64-year-old American woman suffering from severe health problems.

item.title: Top Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli strike on south Beirut
item.description: Ibrahim Mohammed Kobeissi, a top Hezbollah commander, was killed in an Israeli airstrike on South Beirut. The strike also resulted in six deaths and 15 injuries. Kobeissi was crucial to Hezbollah's missile operations. This incident is part of ongoing hostilities between Hezbollah and Israel since the Gaza war began last October.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Golf course gunman charged with attempting an assassination on Donald Trump
item.description: Ryan Wesley Routh has been charged by the United States for attempting to assassinate Donald Trump at his Florida golf course. Authorities allege he aimed a rifle at Trump while he was playing, and had written about his plans months before.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy tunnel: Did Feds find underground bunker at Sean Comb's LA mansion?
item.description: ​Several social media posts claim there is a tunnel underground Diddy's Los Angeles mansion connecting it to the Playboy mansion, the former home of Playboy magazine founder Hugh Hefner. But a Reuters fact check confirmed that the Diddy tunnel claims are fabricated and one of the many conspiracy theories. There are underwater swimming tunnels reported in the mansion, though.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pope offers refuge to jailed Suu Kyi: Report
How Israel sent warning texts? By hacking Lebanon telecom
Israeli strike kills Hezbollah's top missile commander; toll hits 569
item.description: Israel announced the killing of Hezbollah commander Ibrahim Kobeisi amid ongoing conflict. Kobeisi was involved in missile attacks on Israel. The death toll in Lebanon has reached nearly 570, causing mass evacuations and traffic jams at the Syria border. Both sides continue heavy exchanges of fire, impacting civilians and military personnel.

item.title: Barron Trump now has plain-clothed security officers armed with bulletproof vests at NYU. Details here
item.description: ​The increased security did not perturb Barron as he was seen in his usual element. amid the much hullabaloo around him at the campus. Other students are missing no opportunity to take his photo and those content are viral on various social media platforms. Reports said students are approaching Barron Trump with selfie requests that Barron has to turn down owing to security reasons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump was paid $237,500 from Donald Trump's campaign: 'Grifter wife'
item.description: Melania spoke at two political fundraisers for the Log Cabin Republicans this year and for the April event, she was paid $237,500, CNN reported. But it is not clear who cut the check as Charles Moran, president of the Log Cabin Republicans, earlier told CNN that the group did not put up any money for Melania to speak.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delhi roots: New Sri Lankan PM Harini Amarasuriya's fascinating link to India
item.description: Harini Amarasuriya has been appointed as Sri Lanka's 16th Prime Minister, making her the first woman in this role since Sirimavo Bandaranaike in 2000. An academic-turned-politician, she studied Sociology at Delhi University's Hindu College from 1991 to 1994. Her appointment is expected to bolster ties between India and Sri Lanka.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump shares 'nail salon gossip' that Kamala Harris paying $700 for...
item.description: “Their campaign is getting a bunch of people—that’s why you see these people on the side of the road with signs or whatever going to these protests,” said Gangewere, in the video Trump shared. “They get travel paid for and everything and they’re not even able to vote.” The Daily Beast identified the woman as an OnlyFans model and wondered how Donald Trump got hold of her account.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hindus in Bangladesh... : Bangladesh's foreign affairs advisor addresses attacks on minorities
item.description: Md Touhid Hossain stated that Bangladesh's interim government is ensuring the safety of all citizens, including Hindus. Amid political upheaval and protests against Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus, Hossain met India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar at the UNGA to discuss bilateral relations. Yunus faces allegations of acquiring power unconstitutionally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry wins big in visa case; records will not be made public despite drug revelations
item.description: ​Prince Harry's US visa application will remain private despite his admission of taking drugs in his memoir Spare, a judge has ruled in a big win for the Duke of Sussex. Harry in his memoir admitted that he took cocaine and psychedelic mushrooms triggering the case as to whether he should have been allowed into US in 2020.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran president says Hezbollah 'cannot stand alone' against Israel
item.description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that its ally Hezbollah "cannot stand alone" against Israel, which carried out its deadliest day of air strikes on Lebanon since 2006. The Israeli military said it had hit about 1,600 Hezbollah targets on Monday, killing a "large number" of militants, and had carried out more strikes on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump wants to work at a McDonald's because Kamala did so: 'He's obsessed'
item.description: Donald Trump said he wants to work at a McDonald's for half an hour to see what it's like as Kamala Harris has been bragging of having the experience of working at a McDonald's when she was a student. Donald Trump has been harping that Kamala Harris never worked at a McDonald's and there has been no record and she lied about it only to come across as a relatable, middle-class person.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
